chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
yes
cool, we're starting at the twig
there's a small island with a tiger to my left. where should i go?
northeast
all right, i've reached a small island with a butterfly
where to next?
north
okay, i'm now on an island with a tiger, what's the next move?
southwest
cool, there's a big island with a parrot on a tree here, where to now?
southeast
got it, i'm seeing 3 rocks leading to an island with a frog on it
go to the frog
all right, hanging out with the frog
now where?
across the alligator west
done, i'm on the island with the friendly elephant now, where should i head next?
across the rocks west
all right, i see a giraffe here, where to next?
south
we're by the snake, and now?
to the treasure
got it, 2 steps east and voilà, the treasure! *finished*
hi there! que comience el juego!!
what am i supposed to do
alright, your first step is pretty simple
head a little to the left, walk under that wooden bench. you'll cross a trail and almost reach a florist stand, but don't! make a quick 180 turn and go back the way you came, towards our furry friend
then what? What is my goal here?
hold up, we're getting there! now cross over the branch, and keep moving south
you'll spot another white pupper next to a red and white picnic mat. just keep heading that way!
now what
now keep walking and you'll go over the picnic mat
do you see the bowl of berries? yeah, touch that and keep moving on towards the west side. let's go!
ok now what
next thing you're gonna do is cross another branch, this time it's over a river, and you'll be moving north
you good?
i'm there now what
awesome! now, you're gonna see a green bush, but don't touch it! circumnavigate that thing from the right side and-- you guessed it! head towards our florist stand
i'm there now what
great job! now, you're gonna have to take a left turn, go underneath the stand and head towards that big bridge with two bikers
Onwards, friend!
ok now what
you're doing great! just beyond the bridge, you'll see a couple of elderly folks enjoying their newspapers
pass them and head south a few steps. you'll soon find yourself between the oldies and another wooden branch
ok now what
nice! just around that spot, there's a green bush near the end of that wooden branch
make your way over there
now what
alright, turn east now
go between that branch and the bush. you're getting close now! keep it up!
i'm ther
fantastic! now, just keep walking a few steps to the east and
bam! you've made it. see the brown young deer? that's your final stop! well done!
hi there! que comience el juego!!
how do we start?
we're starting at the tent in the north
which way do I go from here, friend?
Down passed the puppy and then turn east
alrighty, going south past the dog
now, i'm standing next to this bright red mushroom. is this where i turn east?
Now you will go just slightly further and then take a U-turn at the blue car
alright, just walked past the red mushroom. i see a blue car up ahead
I'll u-turn there. what's next, friend?
stay on the dirt path and turn south
gotcha! turnin' south on the dirt path
i see a blue telescope, is this right?
yes go around it between the telescope and the bush, when you hit the dirt path go west
got it! between the telescope and the bush, then west
then go up the rocky hill to the cabin
heading up the rocky hill now
you should see a cabin at the top
yup! there's the cabin! it's all wooden, right? we made it, friend! *finished*
hola, q tal? ready to start?
yes
great! let's start this adventure, friend. first, head southwest under the first palm tree
then, take a right, crossing the second tree. now, make a sharp left just before the third tree and stroll south. easy, right?
yes
you got the hang of this! keep going south but make a slight left when you see the brown puppy, then go right, still heading south
being watched by those puppy eyes, aren't you?
haha yes
now what?
haha, glad you're enjoying! next, you'll see a big rock on your left and a smaller one on your right
simply stroll between them until you reach the water. you okay so far?
as cute as that ocean looks, time to get those feet wet! walk into the water and you'll see a big red crab
once you do, turn right and keep going along the big rock. you're doing great!
now what?
great job! proceed west in the water
keep going until you pass a medium rock.
ok now what
watch out for the shark in the water! sharp right turn here, mate
hang in there, you're doing awesome!
dodged it, next?
phew! close one. now, head back to the land and go between that same medium rock and a fancy blue-yellow-white ball
keep heading north. you got this!
until where?
well, mate, you'll see a red tent on your left and a larger speaker on your right soon
just veer slightly to the left and continue walking to the northwest. you're cruising!
between them?
yepp! just like that
later, curve around the tent in an arc. can you spot the sea?
yes
nice one! now, head towards the sea but stop just at the shore
make a right there, going west under that red kayak. you're almost done!
now what
you're bossing this! make a 90-degree turn to the right and move alongside the kayak
almost there!

general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
Do you speak any additional languages? If so, please describe briefly here.

How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
